### VERY MUCH WIP. ### ActiveFacts / CQL Learn ActiveFacts / CQL two minutes at a time. ### Meta [What is CQL](#what-is-cql) [About the author ( @DanielHeath )](#about-the-author) ### Introduction [Installing](#installing) [Using CQL from your ruby code](#using-from-ruby) *** ## What is CQL CQL is a schema definition and data query language. Because it is built on the latest parsing algorithms it is able to read much like natural language while still being formally specified. For instance (a super trivial example): 
Family Name is written as String(20);
Given Names is written as String(20);
Family is identified by its Name;
Person is identified by Family and Given Names where
	Person is of one Family,
	Family includes Person,
	Person has one Given Names;
This is just natural enough that you can collaborate directly with domain experts. Instead of translating their description of the model into SQL you can collaborate directly on the model. *** ## About the author I'm [@danielrheath](https://twitter.com/#!/danielrheath) and I [write about tech occasionally](http://danielrheath.net/). I didn't create ActiveFacts but I do think it's pretty cool. Feel free to get in touch; I don't bite. *** ## Installing Installing is simple if you are familiar with ruby; `gem install activefacts` will do (although releases are somewhat infrequent, so running from [master](https://github.com/cjheath/activefacts) - perhaps [via bundler](http://gembundler.com/git.html) might be a better option). I find guard useful (gem install activefacts-guard doesn't work yet but I plan to write it...)
